sheet.strong: CONFIDENTIALITY, IMPARTIALITY AND NON-DISCLOSURE AGREEMENT: F 443
sheet.span: This agreement must be completed and signed prior to taking part in any assignment on behalf of NiNAS

(Print name in full) hereby agree that all information in relation to the Client /NiNAS, whether it was gained by myself prior to, during or after the assignment, will be treated by myself as confidential information and will not be reproduced or disclosed to any person or organization.

I further agree that I will restrict the above-mentioned information exclusively for purposes directed by NINAS.
Permission to disclose any information about a Client/NiNAS may only be deemed to have been granted once I have obtained unambiguous written permission from NiNAS’s Chief Executive Officer to do so.
I also confirm that I am fully aware of the binding effect of the “Confidentiality” provisions in the agreement between myself and NiNAS.
I also declare that, to the best of my knowledge, there is no possibility of a conflict of interest between myself, my employee, NiNAS and/or the Client in accepting this assignment.
I hereby declare all interests and associations I have / have had with the above- mentioned Client and its personnel, and also declare any actual or perceived commercial, financial, political or other pressure/s that could influence a decision, recommendation, the business of NiNAS and/or may be to my personal gain:

I further agree that I will uphold the principles of impartiality and non-discrimination, as documented in the NiNAS Administrative Policy (P060 Section 2) and to protect the integrity of NINAS and the accreditation system by:
• Observing a non-discriminatory attitude towards the client in the assessment process;
• Treating the client in a fair and equitable manner; and
• Not providing consultancy to the client, nor suggesting the use of consultants.
I further agree that I will abide by all the rules, including applicable policies, procedures and regulations of NiNAS during this assignment

sheet.p: THIS CONTRACT is made and entered into as of , (the "Effective Date:") by and between «Name», hereinafter referred to as the "Assessor/Expert," and the Nigeria Accreditation Service, the national body for the accreditation of Conformity Assessment Bodies (CABs) such as laboratories, certification bodies, product certification bodies, inspection bodies, and personnel certification, in Nigeria, hereinafter referred to as "NINAS".

1. PERFORMANCE:
Assessor’s Responsibilities:
The assessor agrees to fully participate in the assessment by:
1. Preparing for the assessment by reviewing the institutions.
2. Participating in a pre-visit phone call or pre-assessment meeting in conjunction with the rest of the Assessment Team.
3. Performing assessment activities as described in the:
• NiNAS Lead Assessor Job Description
• NiNAS Assessor Job Description
• NiNAS Technical Assessor Job Description
These activities will involve:
• Document Review
• Site Visit
• Findings closure
• Report writing
As described in the Task Assignment Form for a specific activity in conjunction with any additional assessors.

strong.u: Assignments: NINAS is under no obligation to assign any assessments to the Assessor/Expert under this contract. The Assessor/Expert may also refuse to perform any assignment of an assessment for any specific reasons; this reason shall be put in writing.

p.strong: 2. CONFLICT OF INTEREST, CONFIDENTIALITY, IMPARTIALITY AND NON-DISCLOSURE AGREEMENTS The Assessor/Expert shall sign and comply with NINAS's Conflict of Interest, Confidentiality and Intellectual Property as presented in NiNAS forms F443 and F444. The Assessor / Expert shall refuse any assignments prohibited by these policies.

3. UPON COMPLETION OF ASSESSMENT
Assessor/Expert shall submit to the Lead Assessor on the last day of an assessment their
1) Individual Assessor/Expert report, Non conformity reports and all relevant attachments including checklist if any;
2) The Lead Assessor shall on the last day of assessment present the signed off Non conformity reports and supporting information to NINAS and within 5 days of Assessment present his/her final report to NINAS.

4. PAYMENT
NINAS shall effect payment of approved allowances to Assessor/Expert upon successful presentation of the assessment report.
IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have executed this Contract on (DATE) and is valid for three years, extendable if desired by both parties.
